--------------------
Text: The History of Ranching is a mural that was originally located at the Pearl Brewery in San Antonio, Texas.
Triplets:<The History of Ranching
1:
--------------------
<Text: The History of Ranching (Winn):  The Pearl Brewing Company had always preferred to use Texas artists whenever possible.>
Triplets:<The History of Ranching (Winn)
2:
--------------------
<Text: The History of Ranching (Winn):  Long after other brewers had moved to using only photographs in their advertising campaigns, Pearl continued to use ads that featured sketches, drawings, or paintings of the concept or product.>
Triplets:<The History of Ranching
3:
--------------------
Text: The History of Ranching (Winn):  The more famous of Pearl's artistic advertisements were of Judge Roy Bean's Jersey Lilly and a collage called "The Last Fight of Manolete".
Triplets:<The History of Ranching
4:
--------------------
<Text: The History of Ranching (Winn):  Both works saw wide distribution as large printed pictures framed and intended to hang in pubs and bars.>
Triplets:<The History of Ranching (Winn)
5:
--------------------
<Text: The History of Ranching (Winn):  The subjects and sizes changed constantly in Pearl's ads, but one thing remained the same, Pearl made it a point to use local artists.>
Triplets:<The History of Ranching
